content:
Hey @T-release!

I started the draft for the 1.54 blog post (shipping in ~2 weeks) -- https://hackmd.io/ttJNnQ7GRsmC5OFpJPdjJQ

Would be great to get some eyes and edits on it, I didn't populate the more boring sections (stabilized APIs etc) yet, hoping maybe someone else can do that more routine task. Not sure the listing on the release notes is fully ready yet either for copying though.
The section on the incremental compliation says "For the 1.53.0 stable release", when it should say 1.54.
Although, if I read the t-compiler meeting correctly, they are planning to reenable incremental compilation for this release.

The title that said "Attributes can call macros!()" is a bit confusing. I would suggest getting rid of the parentheses in the title, and then giving an example of what a funtion like macro is in the first line.
I'm kind of sleepy now, but I'll try to have another look tomorrow and see if I can find anything.
I know I'm not on T-release, but it's always nice to help with things.

inquisitivecrystal said:

I know I'm not on T-release, but it's always nice to help with things.

Feedback is welcome from everyone. :smile:

Posted https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/870 -- didn't have time to address feedback just yet, would be great if someone could work on that. Happy to grant folks access to my fork or whatever.
I know @XAMPPRocky you mentioned you might have some time this week, I think, not sure if this is still true :)
